name: AppLaunch
overview:
AppLaunch puts the client in control of their social presence with an on-brand platform for managing their communities.

On a basic level, we develop custom social networking sites. On a more important level, we introduce communities to each other. Clients can choose their own level of integration: private networks operate internally and are ideal for organizations sharing sensitive or proprietary information; open networks are categorized and integrated by topic, allowing clients to reach out to a broader audience, generate more traffic and register new users.

Who can benefit from a social network? Companies Governments Brands NGOs Schools Interest groups Churches Unions Musicians Developers Artists Entrepreneurs Sports franchises Housing management Your neighbour Or anyone building of the 600,000 sites that goes online everyday

Examples:

Multinational corp, communicate more efficiently, top-down, bottom-up, Bangkok to Chicago.

Sports clubs can interact with fans, sell tickets, provide a place for discussion, (top level, down)

What problem do we solve?

AppLaunch gives clients direct access to their own communities without relying on other platforms (e.g. Facebook, Twitter) or consenting to third-party Terms and Conditions. Clients “own” their members and use the power of social networking to manage their brand and maximize profits.

The integration makes it easier to start a community from nothing.

If you already have a user base, AppLaunch makes it easier to manage the community and tighten the community.

How are we disruptive?

Just as WordPress and Blogspot have led the publishing revolution, AppLaunch revolutionizes social networking by putting the power of social media back into the hands of brands, enterprises, organizations, entrepreneursâ€”anyone seeking to control their online social presence.

The untapped applications of social technology extend far beyond socializing.

Why would clients want their own social network? Brand control Brand loyalty Employee productivity Information flow Customer knowledge and interaction Extreme analytics Informed decision making Smarter allocation of resources Discovery of new business opportunities Independence from third party sites Maximized profits

Facebook knows a lot about their customers, now everyone can.
